Reviews.Title: “great for families”
Reviews.Author: italy_norway
Reviews.Content: Finding a room accommodating a family of 5 at the last minute turned out to be more challenging than expected. This hotel perfectly served our purpose, a clean room in an OK location for a one day stop over, close to main touristic attractions. The hotel was packed with young participants to a convention, but the service was good. The hotel seems recently renovated and has a fresh look. The value for money is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Marriott Quality”
Reviews.Author: Susan R
Reviews.Content: Our family had a wonderful time t this hotel. The rooms were clean, the staff ws helpful and the location was great. We walked throughout the riverwalk area of NOLA. We did drive when visiting the French Quarter and parked there but you could have walked it. Great hotel! Looking forward to visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “Good property but small”
Reviews.Author: PeaDove
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August because we wanted a room with a suite for an inlaw. They advertise the room as having a privacy wall but that was just deceptive. It provided no privacy. The room was VERY small and when the sofa bed was opened up there was no space to walk. The hotel was central but kinda a bit of a walk to Bourbon street. At first I was turned off by the surrounding but I soon realize it was okay to walk back. The breakfast was pretty good. The selection was okay. My son loved swimming in the pool and they also had a hot tub. The staff is very nice and they provided good direction and advice. Parking is kinda tough. You had to pay like 20 dollars a day for parking. I would recommend this hotel but I would like one a little closer to the garden district.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic FREE breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: wisgirl01
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, would definitely stay here again. The staff was friendly, rooms were very clean, location excellent. But the breakfast was the stand out to me. Hot items, tons of cold items, clean dining area, great hours and free! Wi-fi was also included in the room, which was very convenient. The pool was small, but refreshing and uncrowded. We were a find free or meter parking very close the hotel, so that was not an issue. Easy to find and close to everything. Highly recommend and would definitely stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “hotel was nice but parking is an issue”
Reviews.Author: ladychow
Reviews.Content: We arrived after dark, so were in the warehouse district and kind of deserted. However, the hotel itself is nice but parking was definitely a big issue. There were no more spaces and we were told to find metered parking. Then in order to on the waiting list for inside parking, you have to be at front desk when people are checking out and see if you're lucky. That would have wasted precious time. We were able to find metered spot but so afraid of losing it, that we didn't ventured out far. A shame. However, the location is neat, we were two blocks from the convention center and Riverwalk, which is a mall with food court along the river. We're also walking distance to Harrah's, French Quarter, WWII museum and some restaurants. The rooms were nice, beds were comfortable, breakfast included and was a nice selection which they constantly replenished. There were people arriving for breakfast close to end time and they were still replenishing and didn't rush people out.

Reviews.Title: “nice small suite, but...”
Reviews.Author: piller81
Reviews.Content: Stayed there this weekend (8/11-8/12), taking my niece to school, Suites were small, but ok. My Main issue was the parking. Was not told until we checked in that parking was 1st come, 1st served.We were told there was metered parking on the side if we can find a spot(wknd,no chge).But we had tons of items in 2 cars for college.Other option was covered parking 2&1/2 blocks away.Not really happy about that after traveling for 6-7 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice if you are in the New Orleans area.”
Reviews.Author: ROANDER
Reviews.Content: We (me, my wife, and 2 daughter's - ages 9 and 8) were cruising out of N.O. the last weekend of July and needed a place to stay for the 2 nights prior to our cruise. We chose the Spring Hill Suites due to its close proximity to the cruise ship port and it did not disappoint! Upon first getting to the hotel, most travelers will feel that it is in a "not so good" part of town, but this is not the case. It gives this impression because the buildings directly surrounding the hotel are a bit run down - definitely not a glitzy area of N.O. You'll quickly realize that this area is frequented heavily by locals (due to the 2 night clubs that are located to the east side of the hotel). Needless to say, the N.O. police tend to patrol this area frequently as it has a ton of foot traffic/party-go-er's at night. Even at night, we felt safe walking around the areas surrounding the hotel. Check in was a breeze. The staff was nice and helpful. We stayed on the 4th floor east side. The hotel's layout can be somewhat confusing. So either bring a compass or pay attention to the signs directing you to your room...... The view from our room was to the east, so we had a view of the nightclubs. This made for some interesting people watching at night...... :) The room itself was very spacious and clean. The beds were very comfortable (beds are a bit on the soft side - the way we like them). Just about the only complaint I have about the room was that it needed a new iron. Overall a great room! The hotel's public spaces are spacious, kept clean, and are well maintained. The continental breakfast is what you would expect a continental breakfast to be. Nothing fancy here, but still good. Be aware that there is a per day fee for parking at this property ($20 bucks plus taxes of $2.40 per day). The parking feels secure, but is a bit annoying. For one, the spaces are cramped - so pray that you find parking next to someone that takes the time to park correctly :) ........ Also, the hotel staff does NOT do a good job of preventing guests from using the only entryway to the hotel as a vehicle loading/unloading/exit area. When this happens, it creates a bottleneck for guests attempting to get into the hotel and therefore creates backups that spill out from the hotel's entrance and into the street. If any of the hotel's management personnel are reading this, please ask your staff to monitor this and not allow it to happen! Anyway, all in all a good stay. Just a few annoyances..... I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Rooms, Good Breakfast, Good Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: lmguyton
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this property for a wedding weekend. The rooms were standard SHS size and decor. The hotel itself is nice and clean. There is a courtyard on the second floor. If you are a guest and stay on that floor your room opens up to the courtyard. You can hear noise from that courtyard if there are large parties out there. Walls are on the thin side. We could hear the conversation of the guest next door every morning. The hotel is only a few blocks from Harrah's and Canal Street. It is a good walk from the French Quarter. Be aware.....there is a $20 nightly parking fee. Rooms average $99 plus parking.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, value”
Reviews.Author: JohnColumbus_Ohio
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was a recently renovated Marriott brand hotel, and it was close to the cruise ship terminal at the port. The location is within walking distance of many of the tourist areas in the city, such as Canal Street. The convention center is very close and within easy walking distance. This hotel also can serve as a good place to stay if you are departing on a cruise as it is within walking distance of the cruise ship port. The rooms are clean and brand new. The rate I got was $79 per night, which I found to be a good value. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Close to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: colg1
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Spring Hill Suites right by the N.O. Convention Center. Excellent value. Close to the CC which was why I was in town. Room was clean and airy. Lots of space to work. Front desk staff were excellent. Very helpful. Checkin was a breeze. Checkout too. I called down for cab and it was there when I left the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good location”
Reviews.Author: oldgeorgian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in what is known as the warehouse district. The area seems to be an up and coming one, with some new restaurants and attractions. A short walk away is the WWII museum, Civil War Museum, Riverwalk and the Convention Center. Check in around 3:00 p.m. was met by no one at the desk and finally after calling out two to three times help arrived. The actual check in was easy and the room was clean and neat. The style of the interior looked early 70's style. The suite had a two queen size bed and a sofa and chair. There was a 32" TV and it was mounted on a stand/small dresser between where the two beds were located and the semi-room with the sofa(pull out bed) and chair. This side of the room also has a microwave, refrigerator, sink, desk and chair. Unfortunately when the sofa bed is pulled out the amount of room left between the TV stand and pull out bed is minimal. The amount of drawer space is also minimal. The bathroom is quite nice with the tub and toilet separated from the sink. Every morning there is a free breakfast with scrambled eggs, sausage or Canadian bacon, waffles, cereal, yogurt, fruit, coffee, juice and tea. I found the pool small and inadequate, however the whirlpool and exercise room are better choices. Parking especially on the weekend was quite tight and could be a problem. Remember parking cost $20,00 a night. This is a good property in an area I believe will only improve with time. Unfortunately I believe the layout of the rooms leave something to be desired. The rooms were clean and well kept as was the hotel in general. I would stay here again, I only wish that the room had a little better width Please note-Riverwalk closes at 6 p.m. which limits the close by shopping. The WWII was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2cowboys
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite marriot properties in New Orleans. The hotel is clean and modernly decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: osterhoutb
Reviews.Content: The SpringHill Suites was the perfect location for a convention hotel. Only 2 blocks away from the convention center, it was only 20 minutes to the French Quarter. Quiet setting, the breakfast was great. Wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel that does the basics right”
Reviews.Author: mphopkins99
Reviews.Content: Here for 3 nights on business. As many have mentioned, hotel is in a great spot for the convention center, just 2 blocks away. If you want to get to the heart of the French Quarter, its a good 15-20 minute walk. The hotel itself does the basics well. Room was clean, bed was comfortable and the pool area was in good shape. Staff were friendly and helpful with directions, and breakfast was well stocked despite it being packed. The only problem you might have is parking. When I checked in, I was allowed to park in their covered lot only because I was a Marriott rewards member. Otherwise, I would have been in an open lot down the street. If you want something fancy or close to the action, this won't be the place to stay. However, for the price, this hotel is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “SpringHill Suites will not let you down.”
Reviews.Author: RThomaston
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at SpringHill Suites during the time two large conventions were going on at the convention center. Though "busy" is an understatement, the staff wasn't fazed; they are obviously used to the fast pass. Every time I walked in the lobby a friendly voice greeted me from behind the counter - even when I obviously was not walking in their direction. Every morning at the very nice breakfast, despite the standing room only turnout at times, the ladies that kept the food stocked (nothing ever ran out) were smiling at the least. One of the ladies seemed to always be singing. Besides the folks behind the counter and the breakfast staff, housekeeping was efficient. They did a great job with our room and when you saw them in the hall they too were always cheerful. Because we were in New Orleans for one of the conventions, having only a 2 block walk to the convention center was GREAT! Many of the folks I attended the convention with had to walk a number of blocks. One may think that with such close proximity to the convention center the price to park would come at a premium. Well, think again. While I wasn't excited about paying $20 a day for parking, I talked to several folks who paid $30 or more per day.....and they had no idea where there car even was! One person said that they were told that their car was about 6 blocks away! Not at SpringHill Suites. I parked my car myself in the on-site garage and I could come and go as much as I wanted. Of course no one should go to New Orleans without taking in the culture of the French Quarter. Though we did drive the few blocks and pay to park, you really would not have to do that. It isn't too far to walk. We were just on a time table and didn't need to get too sweaty (we were there in the middle of June so the New Orleans summer was making its presents known). Yea, we'd stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention Location”
Reviews.Author: MarkyMarkGa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 6 consecutive nights and never had a problem. The room was clean, quiet (the courtyard side) and well maintained. The location was only 2 short city blocks from the Convention Center. The breakfast was good and the service for it was great! The clerks at the desk made me feel very welcomed and the parking garage was extremely convenient with in and out privileges. The service at the Howlin' Wolf den across the street was good and they had a great inexpensive steak sandwich. Down Peters St was a very good pizza place called Pie, Pizza and Pasta. They too had very good service.

Reviews.Title: “good value, nice room near the convention center”
Reviews.Author: quantrek
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Springhill Suites in New Orleans for a convention at the end of May, beginning of June 2012. Our room was large, clean and comfortable. The free breakfast was good and varied slightly day to day. The hotel was only about 2 1/2 blocks - very easy walk to the convention center and about 3/4 blocks from the riverwalk. Maybe about a 15 to 30 minute walk or a 7$ cab drive to the French Quarter/Garden District restaurants. The staff were very pleasant and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: titanman24
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. The most comfortable bed I have ever slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: trvbugz
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to NO at the last minute and wanted something near the Riverwalk, well this hotel had a great rate and was close to everything! The hotel is Beautiful and very clean! The beds were so so comfy and the room was Big!!! The front desk staff was really nice and helpful!! The breakfast crew was as well even bringing fresh food out after the official closing time!! NO has hundreds of hotels but this is my new favorite! The only down side to me was the parking it was High like 24$ / night!!! And the curtain was very thick but the sun still shined over the top. Also you could walk to pretty much anything.. Just wear comfy shoes! But we shall be back!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, good value, and convenient to convention center”
Reviews.Author: Lasrman
Reviews.Content: I was of mixed mind in writing this review. One the one hand the hotel is good value, the staff are extremely friendly an helpful, the rooms are clean, and the location handy for the convention center. There is a small pool and spa and the exercise room is small but well equipped. The breakfast is excellent. There are a few things that are a little weak; the furnishings are average, the maid service sloppy (one day they forgot a bath mat, and the whole week they ignored a half hanging darkness curtain which had come unhooked from its carrier). And some parts were just bizarre: I was in a side building from the main and though I had two rooms the bedroom was too small to have an open suitcase anywhere on the floor so I had to leave it in the living room. They were connected by a small hall and the TV was on a side table in the hall facing the opposite wall. You could kind of tilt it to the living room and look into the hall to watch it or tilt it toward the bedroom and watch it from one side of the bed (but not the other). I didn't come to N.O. to watch TV so no sweat but still....

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: fitteacher716
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel in the warehouse district because of our trust in the Marriott brand and that the price was about 50% less than the hotels in the French quarter, about one mile away. It was great. The room was extremely clean; bed was very comfortable; air-conditioning was very good with the thermostat showing the temperature, not just warmer/cooler; the little fridge and microwave worked perfectly. It was a great plan to have the sink area outside the toilet/tub room. The fitness room was stocked with two LifeFitness state of the art treadmills, one elliptical trainer, and one recumbent bike, all in fine working condition. In additions there was one weight bench and an array of free-weight dumbbells. The temperature in the fitness room was kept at 67 degrees--perfect. It only took 12 minutes to walk to the French quarter and the streets were safe. Staff was friendly, courteous and helpful--especially when we asked about local eateries. And the breakfast was excellent--eggs, meats, a waffle bar, many different types of breads, juices, coffees, etc. The only downside--and a real disappointment--was having to pay $22.40 extra per day for parking, which was covered and part of the hotel's property. I found that insulting. It should have been an amenity for all and especially Marriott Rewards membera.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole S
Reviews.Content: OK, this hotel is in the warehouse district, not the Quarter, so you're probably not wanting to spend French Quarter money. That aside, I think this hotel was great. Nice, modern decor, I liked the heat/cool unit (it had a thermostat with actual temperatures rather than "less cold" or "more cold" like some places. Pool was in a courtyard with nice shade for us burn-prone people. Nice people. Very nice normal (as opposed to wall-mounted) hair dryer. Large room with a big couch and a wet bar with microwave and mini-fridge if you want that sort of thing. There was no freezer in the refrigerator, though. We brought some of those frozen drinks and weren't able to freeze them. A few cons: The bed in the king room was reallyclose to the closet. Maybe 18 inches? It was hard to maneuver suitcases around back there. Not quite enough light in the bathrooms. I also wish they had an option to keep your bed linens/towels if you want.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel, very courteous and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: t25624
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the first weekend of JazzFest. Overall the hotel was in a good location and the staff was very friendly. A few things that could be improved and didn't seem typical of a Marriott property. We had no shampoo or soap in our room. I inquired with the cleaning person (in the hallway) and was told they had run out. The next day, still no shampoo or soap so I went to the front desk. The buffet ran out of things and when I inquired, I was told that was it, they were out (Raisin Bran and Granola cereal for example). They did keep ice water mostly filled all day long. The spa/gym area had water but no cups. (I went to the lounge and retrieved some.) Overall it was good but between average and very good, I'll go average.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a big city”
Reviews.Author: TJandTR
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a pleasant stay here. Our first room (pool-view near the 2nd floor guest laundry) had a continous loud rumble in the HVAC vent. About an hour after check-in, we complained to the front desk. They readily offered to move us to another room (we accepted), and this room was very quiet and comfortable for our 3-night stay. Our king room looked over the interior courtyard pool. The bathroom had minimal storage, but the wet bar was larger than usual. Otherwise, it is a standard SpringHill. The hotel is conveniently located in the Warehouse District, and covered on-site parking is a reasonable $20 per night. There are several good little restaurants within a few short blocks. Our favorite dinner was at Chef John Besh's American Sector Restaurant at the National WWII Museum - reservations are recommended! The SpringHill's breakfast room had decent selection of foods, but ... There were no trays for take-away, which was particularly annoying when the room was overflowing with guests on college-graduation morning. The breakfast bar only offered destructive styrofoam for cups, bowls & plates (there were glasses and ceramic cups in my room, so I know there's a dishwasher in the building). And, the TV should have been on closed-captioning instead of trying to blast over a crowded roomful of voices each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Value”
Reviews.Author: GreenBiners
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel in the warehouse district. Nearby food, great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: MySeaBiscuit13
Reviews.Content: I was there on business and had to give an important presentation. Unfortunately, it was also jazz festival and the hotel was sold out. Unfortunately, it was jazz festival and most people were not there to work but to party, which normally is fine with me. However, there are bars on two sides of this hotel and apparently they are open 24 hours a day! So needless to say the loud music is non stop and I was unable to sleep. Even a discussion with the manager was of no help. He had no other rooms and he said it was not something he could control. This hotel is near the convention center, you would think that it would cater to business people, but that is not the case. So if you plan to be at the bar until 8am, when the music finally stopped, you will probably like this place. However, if you plan to sleep at all during the night time hours, you might want to try another location. I will say that most of the staff was nice and helpful and that the location was good. However, given my experience here, I cannot recommend it and would not consider staying here when I am back in NOLA next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value/Location & CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: exNYfamily
Reviews.Content: I don't know why anyone would say this place was dirty, our room was spotless the whole time we were there with timely housekeeping service. In fact, if you are sleeping in a bit (as can happen in NOLA) and just let the housekeepers know what time you plan to be away from the room, they will actually come back at the appointed time. Our room was huge, with a pull-out sofa, microwave and small fridge. Bear in mind these are not suites, so there's just a tiny divider between the king bed and the sofabed with 1 large flatscreen TV in the middle that swivels. Breakfast is included here, and the choices are typical for this type of Marriott property, so if you crave a real southern breakfast you should probably head out of the hotel. But if, like me, you just want some coffee and yogurt to start your day, this is fine. (I was saving room for all that JazzFest food!) The staff in the breakfast area is cheery and helpful and keeps things running smoothly and cleanly. Front desk staff was competent and polite. To those who say that they are not good at making dining recommendations I say, really, can you blame them? They're working in a Marriott, which usually trains employees to be careful about making recommendations outside the hotel. Plus, you're in NOLA! The choices are overwhelming and you can't expect a hotel employee to suss out your dining preferences and budget, better to check on here or Yelp for advice. The location is excellent, 2 blocks from convention center in the heart of the Warehouse District. Yes, there is a taxi stand right outside the door, which was very convenient for us JazzFesters ($5 per person to the Fairgrounds and yeah, why not share a cab with complete strangers? Makes for a fun ride and better for the environment.) As for cabs to French Quarter, there are better options: 1. You can walk it, it's about a mile or 2. If you walk down to the Convention Center and turn down it's side on Julia Street there is a Streetcar!! It runs up and down the waterfront all the way to Frenchman Street. They come about every 5-10 minutes and cost $1.25 (exact change recommended but not mandatory). There are stops about every 4 blocks, so you can get off at French Market, Dumaine or Frenchmen or other streets. The driver of one told me they run from 8am-10pm 7 days a week. And for those who say the area around the hotel is sketchy at night I say: This is a big city! All big cities get a little sketchy at night! So don't wear your diamonds or carry all your money, be aware of your surroundings and you'll do fine. We had no issues. There is a nightclub across the street from the hotel - Republic of New Orleans - it has excellent music shows but if you don't want to hear noise at night on weekends, request a room on the quiet side of the hotel (we did, and it was very quiet). Silver lining is you can go to a show there and stagger home to the Springhill and crash out-no need for transportation at all! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good/Bad”
Reviews.Author: jwmarkey
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet comfortable hotel 1 1/2 blocks to convention center. Usual motel breakfast, good service but front desk made poor (or no) recommendations for meals, ignoring convention center which we didn't think about. Maybe that was just was well since the convention center food was poor-terrible. All in all a good place to stay. Emeril's is just around the corner and there were several pricey restaurants in the immediate neighborhood, plus some real funky places within walking distance. Our cab rides to the French Quarter were $8-10 each way. The room was small, but ok for two and was well maintained in a re-purposed building.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte954
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a meeting at the convention center. Within walking distance, courteous staff, excellent breakfast. The room was very nice, quiet but very small. Basically for one person. The housekeeping was very good on some days, not so good on others. Nice walk to French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but check you sheets!”
Reviews.Author: homit111
Reviews.Content: Whenever I check into a hotel I check the bedding...I was appauled...I found bloody stains all over the sheets! They were obvious and should never been put on the bed to begin with! I called the desk and they immediately sent a team of people up to inspect...they apologized and changed the sheets right away...then when I booked the hotel I used my Marriott points and the person that booked me told me she booked me under a special promotion to get 2 free adult and 2 children's passes to either the zoo or aquarium...when I asked the person at the desk she said that it didn't count for me because I only used my points? Really? I only stay at Marriott properties and travel at least 3 times per month on business! Not what I feel was good customer service....need to put the breakfest in different stations..was very backed up with everyone waiting for their toast! Not sure if I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great price”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: Good hotel to stay in new Orleans . Service and front desk staff excellent, french quarter, river front and French market take 10 to 15 minutes stroll, a great advantage as it is difficult to find free parking in new Orleans. The hotel has a gated car park but they charge 22 dollars per 24 hours. The rooms are large and well maintained. Highly recommended. We booked the room with clever hotels.com which offered the best rate at the time of booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but best to stay in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: silCa
Reviews.Content: I love the room. Clean and spacious. Very quiet. Buffet breakfast included oatmeal, waffle, cold cereals, muffins, eggs and sausage/ham , juice, coffee and tea. is about 10 minutes walk to Canal street at the start of the French quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Ready to return!”
Reviews.Author: LSongstress1
Reviews.Content: Everything went without a hitch. From the service when we arrived to the easy checkout, everything was excellent. This is your best choice for a great place to say!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again and again”
Reviews.Author: Kerry A
Reviews.Content: Great hotel close to everything. Canal and Bourbon Street a 10 minute walk. 2 minutes to the Convention Center and Riverwalk, a cool mall right on the water. Hot breakfast with fresh fruit and service with a smile. Friendly helpful staff. Clean and nicely decorated hotel, fridge and microwave with wetbar in our sutie. Safe area (Warehouse District). Beautiful outdoor pool with plenty of chairs and tables for lounging or eating lunch outside. Very cool bar across the street called Howling Owl....casual spot for cold beer and Fantastic menu.....try the Catfish Tacos.....Awesome!! Will come back to New Orleans and will stay at Springhill again. TIP: Bring your own bottle and wine opener. Thanks to all the wonderful staff once again!! Cubby1066

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: billfrog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 1 and 2 prior to a cruise out of New Orleans. There were just 2 of us, so the room was plenty big. We had a Studio King Room. Its bigger than a regular hotel room, but not as big as rooms at long term hotels like Residence Inn. It had a small fridge, a microwave and a sink with running water in the kitchen/work area. It had a nice big couch and a large flat screen TV. Only one TV in the room. The living room and bedroom are next to each other, and the TV swivels so it can be viewed from either room. This was a little odd, but we only watched from the couch - so no issue. The bed was big and very comfortable. We had a room overlooking the pool area, and was fairly quiet at night. I had requested a room on the inside because had read in previous reviews that rooms facing the streets can be noisey at night, and I am a lite sleeper. It got a little loud from hallway noise Friday night because there was a huge Cheerleader convertion at the Convention Center, and there were a lot of young girls around Junior High age running around the halls till about midnight. The free breakfast was very good each morning with hot entries and also a waffle making station. The waffles were great. Free internet access in the room, and it worked very well. Overall, a great place to stay prior to a cruise out of NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel near cruise port”
Reviews.Author: cat330
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basically 2 blocks from th cruise port, convention center and the Riverwalk. They have a great breakfast each morning but restaurants are not close. The night clerk gave us a name for pizza that delivered to the hotel and it was great and fast service. The rooms are very large. The taxi ride from the hotel to the cruise port was miserable. due to the way the cruise port is designed..it took us 45 minutes to go there and the taxi driver was not happy about it.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: FansofDisney
Reviews.Content: This property recently renovated the rooms with beautiful furnshings, carpet and wallpaper in soothing colors. The room was comfy. The staff were gracious and very helpful. It is close to the Convention Center and not far from the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the price and location”
Reviews.Author: klb30
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced hotel in a great location. Right near the convention center and just about a 10 minute or less walk to the French Quarter. There was breakfast every morning (eggs, pastries, yogurt, waffles, etc) and the rooms were spacious and clean. Parking is a little pricey, but seems to be the norm for most major cities. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisey”
Reviews.Author: RayTer
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel, very near the convention center and cruise ships. The hotel is old but fairly well maintained. The room was a nice size and had some nice amenities. The staff seemed friendly and helpful. Our room looked out over the Riverwalk and convention center. The problem with this room was that there was a bar across the street from our room that had a loud party going on till 4 am. At one point in time the police came in to stop a fight or something.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel may be nice but housekeeping sucks!!! Never will I stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: cormiertx
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel at 1am and there was no valet parking available but we still got charged 22.00 for overnight self parking. The hotel lobby looked nice right along with the rest of the hotel but when we got up to our room it was another story. This was a large hotel with 4 hallways that made up a square so there are plenty of rooms. We were put in a room that was adjacent to back street with two bars, loud music and people hanging on the street down below. Its a good thing we were exhausted and could sleep and we had a 10 month old baby with us! My son opened his fold out sofa and out came a torn condom paper package and under the couch was also a pizza restaurant menu that was not on the premises. Then the next morning we had an automatic coffee maker in our room and when my husband went to make the coffee the old coffee grinds were still in the coffee machine. I was shocked that a Marriott would put up with this kind of conditions as part of their chain and we paid more to stay her thinking it would be a better hotel than the other's around the same area. This is the first and last time I will ever stay here again when traveling to or pass through New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Nice Room, and Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: DSHooch
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while I was in town for a conference. It is just a couple of blocks from the conference center so it was SUPER convenient. It is also walking distance to the French Quarter so we just walked everywhere (even though it was an unusually cold weekend). The room was nice and roomy. It had a desk so I could work and a couch for relaxing at night. The staff was REALLY, REALLY nice. Everytime we walked past a staff member they made sure to smile and say hello. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The only thing that was wrong was the loose cable on the back of our TV which had to be jiggled every so often. No big deal. Complimentary breakfast was good. I definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: TWaltOH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only 2 blocks from the New Orleans Convention Center. While the SpringHill Suites may be seen as a discount stay in the Marriott family of hotels, the service here was outstanding. The staff was friendly and helpful with information on great places to eat, as well as booking taxis and shuttles as we needed. The breakfast staff is the friendliest bunch of people!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific service, stylish and modern decor”
Reviews.Author: map0125
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a couple nights during the Sugar Bowl. The hotel is within walking distance of Bourbon, the Superdome and Jackson Square. However, it is a considerable walk. Easy for me to do, but my companion wasn't thrilled. There are taxis and also the streetcar if you'd rather. The walk is approx 1-1.5 miles. I enjoy walking New Orleans though. Front desk staff was friendly and very accomadating. They granted us a late check out due to us having an evening flight and also stowed our luggage once we did check out so that we could enjoy the city before leaving for the airport. Very large lobby and breakfast area with a huge flat screen tv and a fireplace. Lots of couches, chairs and high top tables. All very stylish. The lobby bath even has a tv screen in the mirror. Our room was on the third floor, not far from the elevator. It was VERY spacious and offered a large flat screen, sink, refrigerator and microwave. Although open, it was almost like 3 little rooms. There was a nice desk w/ chair, coffee table and couch in the entry area along with the kitchenette. Our room overlooked a large courtyard with chairs & umbrella'd tables. The hotel also has a lovely courtyard with a pool. The room was bright and fresh, decorated in white, blue and green. It was very modern, hip and refreshing. Good water pressure in shower and the bath was pretty standard. Sink seperate from bath and commode. We had no issues with our stay and would certainly return to this location. This hotel makes me excited to stay with Springhill Suites in other areas as I had never stayed in that division of Marriott before. This location did have a parking garage but we did not have a vehicle. It is on a quiet street but there is dining and bars nearby with the Howling Wolf being directly across the street also. Decent tacos and TERRIFIC fresh made salsa and homemade chips. Convention Center is very close and also the Riverwalk shopping is just a couple short blocks. The Riverwalk has a large food court with pizza, Steak Escape and many local food offerings. Also, frozen alcoholic drinks. Many souvenir shops and a few chain stores such as Gap, Nine West, Lids etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: LouLouWho
Reviews.Content: I stayed st this hotel the night before a cruise and enjoyed my stay. The staff was very helpful with a delayed luggage situation from the airlines, and gave great recommendations for restaurants. Very close to the River Walk and the trolly to the French Quarter. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: freedominc98
Reviews.Content: It's part of the Marriott family so you should expect a good experience. Overall the quality of our stay was good. The front desk was great. The room upon check in was nice, and clean. We stayed in January so we couldn't use the outdoor pool, but the small court yard with the pool looked very nice. They do serve a complimentary breakfast in the morning which was good considering it was complimentary. It is convenient to the Riverwalk Market place. If you don't mind a 10 minute walk, it is convenient to the French Quarter too as well as the Superdome. We stayed two nights and found it very accomodating. Beware there is a fee for parking, but most NO hotels charge a fee for parking. My only complaint is that our room didn't get serviced after our first night stay. I am sure it was an oversight because that has never happened at a Marriott property. Overall a good value and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for an unpretentious hotel”
Reviews.Author: JP M
Reviews.Content: Lobby and breakfast area are both attractive and functional. Hotel does not have a bar or restaurant (plenty restaurants nearby), nor does it have other fancy amenities of the much pricier high-rise hotels. Room excellent, though our mattress was a tad tired. Staff helpful and friendly. Self-serve breakfast a bit above average. Riverside trolley is 2 blocks walk; St Charles trolley is 5 blocks. Walking to the Quarter takes about 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “bam”
Reviews.Author: nitabo
Reviews.Content: Found this room last minute due to mishap at a prior place. So HAPPY I found this place>>>> Lovely, great customer service, fascinating decor, friendly staff. One person inparticular I would like to thank.... INDIA!!!!! Wonderful people skills.. Had been communicating with her days before and was glad to finally put a face with her name. She deserves *****(five stars) I would gladly recommend theSpringhill Suites to anyone looking for a good stay> Very convenint location.

Reviews.Title: “Springhill Suites”
Reviews.Author: billandwendy
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to stay in this hotel during Halloween. It was the first year New Orleans celebrated with a parade and it was unbelievable. The hotel was just a few blocks from Bourbon Street activities and a nice walk after enjoying all the things you can do in New Orleans. We found the hotel to be nice, not ritzy, but you get what you pay for. It was clean, comfortable and very reasonable in price. The staff were extremely helpful and very friendly. Enjoyed the free breakfast daily as well as the free wi fi. Location was close to everything and really close to the bus/trolley line. We purchased a 4 day pass and could get on and off the bus/trolley any time during our stay - it was really convenient and cost effective. We found that the hotel had lots of valuable information on what to see and do in New Orleans and they were eager to expound on the good things happening in their city even after a lot of the city was destroyed by Katrina. We thoroughly enjoyed the city, the hotel and the New Orleans experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good base of operations, especially for cruisers”
Reviews.Author: ShowMeVegas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good base of operations if you are attending a convention, staying before or after a cruise, or even when visiting the French Quarter if you don't mind a short walk. The convention center and Riverwalk is a short two block trek and the cruise terminal only a block further. It's only about eight blocks to the French Quarter from the hotel at St. Joseph @ St. Peter in the Warehouse District and a bit shorter to Harrah's casino. There is also good access to the riverfront trolley (tracks behind the Riverwalk and between it and the river) to take you to the French Quarter and back if you tire of walking. The street to access the trolley stop is between the convention center and the Riverwalk (Third St?) one block toward the Quarter from the hotel. Check-in was quick and efficient. The staff was helpful, if not overly effervescent, with directions and the surrounding bars and eateries. The walk to our room was a bit convoluted and winding but once at the room we found it very adequate for our needs with a desk & chair, bar area with sink, fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The segregated sleeping area was large and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom area was nicely sized with a tub/shower combo and commode in a closed area and an open vanity with sink nearby. A roomy closet with iron/board was handy. The large, flat screen TV was nice but situated between a sitting area with a sofa and the bedroom so the sight line from the bedroom was a little less than idea as the TV could not swivel much. A large courtyard area was rather non-descript. The trio of elevators were roomy and worked well. We took the train so parking was not an issue for us. The area was safe and vibrant with nightlife but not in the hotel so things were pretty peaceful within its walls. We were catching a cruise on a Saturday and were very glad we chose this hotel as the cruise terminal was very accessible by walking with moderate luggage. The new terminal was a mess, jammed with traffic and people. Some were let out by their taxi drivers long before the terminal so they could avoid the traffic and seek other fares. Within five minutes of leaving our hotel, we arrived at the terminal after a very pleasant walk. We even had time to have one last po-boy at the dining area in the Riverwalk before boarding our ship while others were frantic and stuck in traffic. I would highly recommend staying at this property before or after a cruise. It will make life and transitioning much easier. We had no complaints with the property and found our accommodations satisfactory and reasonable. We would stay here again without question, particularly if taking a cruise out of New Orleans as it was perfect for this purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Nanaluvsnyc
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this hotel to attend show at the Convention Center. Plenty of room with sitting area and mini kitchen area with sink, coffee maker, microwave and small refrigerator. Just what we needed. Housekeeping was very nice as was Gilbert who we encountered while having breakfast one morning. He was so helpful and we are so thankful to him. If you are a light sleeper please let the front desk know because our room was noisy at night. There was a nightclub across the street which played music most of the night. However, I always take earplugs whenever I travel and my two companions are not light sleepers so it didn't keep us from getting a good nights sleep. The beds at this hotel are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Parking”
Reviews.Author: ItBeMeEverywhere
Reviews.Content: This hotel charges $20.00 a night to park, which in itself would not be a problem. But after you pay the parking their is no place to park. There are approx. 200 rooms and only 100 places to park. So, let me do the math, if they are full they are 100 parking spaces short. To top this in the evening, they have valet parking, that claims to not be affilated with the hotel, but uses this same small lot to park cars. Now making it impossible to find a spot. This service cost $30, for the exact same spots to fight over. When you ask the hotel for help since you paid them, they are useless. We waited approx. 20-30 minutes for a guest to leave so we could take their spot. Now for the best part, in the morning the valet service is GONE, good luck finding your keys. We had a one bedroom suite, it was large and nice. But if you plan on watching tv good luck. You could only see 1/2 of the tv from either the bedroom or living room. This is because there is only one tv for the 2 rooms with a corner between them. This hotel claims to be within walking distance of Bourbon St......put on your walking shoes. It is 1 1/2 miles each way. To some this is a short stroll, but in 100 degress and 80% humidity, it sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Okay service.”
Reviews.Author: JoyMD
Reviews.Content: Located in the posh warehouse district, surrounded by the best restaurants in the city. 15 min walk to Jackson Square. Rooms are spacious and clean. Breakfast is actually one of the nicest ones I've seen in this type or category of marriot hotels. I only gave 4 out of 5 because the lady at the breakfast area did not seem to happy that it was morning. Someone asked to refill the coffee dispenser and she said "My goodness it's coming". Minor flaw though.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, really close to convention center”
Reviews.Author: slynnem
Reviews.Content: I liked this place- all re-done and nice suites. Breakfast was good, clean and quiet, nice service. No restaurant though. 1.5 blocks from Convention center. Would stay here again. Clean, but bathtub and toilet could have been a taddd cleaner. Not a huge deal though.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: damck2
Reviews.Content: The property must have been newly renovated as it looked nearly new. The decor was beautiful and the staff was extremely helpful. This was one of the best Springhill Suites i've visited. I will definitely return really soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property-Convenient”
Reviews.Author: mmrr4
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights last week in conjunction with business convention . One block walk to both Morial Convention Center and St. Charles streetcar going Uptown; short 15-minute walk to French Quarter--very convenient. Construction nearly complete; some minor finishing touches needed , but overall, very nice decor and lobby area. Nice, new, bright rooms. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “checking in”
Reviews.Author: Shoe_man30196
Reviews.Content: So the person at the front desk told me they start making you pay for parking at 6am...but it was really 8am...so i probably valeted when i didn't really need to on a weekend night. The valet process took like 30 min so they seemed to be a bit understaffed. Overall the hotel was clean and the free breakfast wasn't awesome but definitely wasn't bad either. Not bad but nothing special as a hotel. Nice location though.

Reviews.Title: “Went above what I have ever experienced before...”
Reviews.Author: Gagal
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the process of renovation but we were never bothered by any of it. We stayed in a room that was just completed and they have done a very nice job. It is pretty convenient to the WWII museum and the convention center. It is a little of a walk to the heart of the action but the price reflects that. There are decent restaurants within walking distance. They have a really nice breakfast that is included in the room price so you aren't paving the pavement looking for morning sustenance. But the biggest thing happened after we came home. I had placed a lace top in a drawer so that the lace would not get damaged in the suitcase. It was also a garment that could not hang up. Well, when we got home...no top. So we called the hotel. I left a message with the housekeeping supervisor and two days later, I got a call back. They had found my top AND another top that I had forgotten about. It was shipped to me and I had it two days later!!! I really appreciate their efforts. I have left things before in hotels and it was "kiss it good-bye". We will stay there again!! Good Job Spring Hill Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Location is fabulous, the hotel is decent...”
Reviews.Author: FEMAtraveler
Reviews.Content: Only a 10-15 min walk from the French Quarter... this is a nice plus. The price is reasonable considering the location. The rooms are merely adequate, if you are visiting NOLA to go to The Quarter and spend your time there and need a place to sleep, this works just fine. If you actually have to stay in you hotel for any length of time, you might want to look for something else. With that said, I found the hotel staff to be friendly and competent and the breakfast bar was very good. The parking situation is a little weird, they charged me for valet parking, but I had to park my own car... they said the only parking available was in valet and they didn't have anyone to park my car available. It was only a $5 difference, but still think it was a little weird.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MDTravelBug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Springhill Suites New Orleans Convention center the middle of August 2011. The weather was unusally hot, even the locals were complaining. So New Orleans in August plus extreme heat and humidity, wow, quite the experience. The hotel was nice, the floor we were on (4th) recently remodled so the room was very nice. The A/C was wonderful and thankfully worked very well. The suite was nice and big, but no true door between sleeping area and sitting area, so if you want to watch tv whlle your partner sleeps, it doesn't really work too well, plus the tv straddles the two rooms. Since you have to swivel the tv to watch it, you cannot watch from the bedroom and the sitting room at the same time.The one really negative about the room is no in room safe, so no place to secure your electronics while you are gone. The lobby really has no sitting area, only two chairs space on opposite ends of the room, but that may have been due to the renovations going on while we were there. The comp breakfast was so so and the hot entrees were always cold. Again, due to the renovatons going on, the breakfast was held in a meeting room as opposed to the dining room. The business center had four pc and two printers (one of the printers was not working while we were there). The staff were all nice and helpful. Nice small workout facility and indoor spa , however the outdoor pool was in a courtyard where you heard the roaring of the a/c units, not too relaxing, It felt like I was sitting on the runway at the airport, very loud. The hotel has a nice location. About 100 yard walk to the convention center and lots of good restaurants close by. Mulates was a wonderful place to go, good food and good cajun music. Harrahs casino was a short walk and riverwalk was close by as well. We took a cab to bourban street and did manage to walk back to our hotel. Stopping at the casino for an hour, this was about midway. If you are going to a convention at the convention center, this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Bourbon St but not in the middle of everywhere”
Reviews.Author: KandyKane056
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this property for Christmas vacation. Since my parents were coming with us we wanted somewhere close to the attractions but not in the middle of them, so it will be quiet. The hotel is walking distance to Harrah's casino, Bourbon St., the French Quarter, Convention Center and the Riverwalk Marketplace. I didn't like that we have to pay for parking but we save money, since we left the car at the hotel and we didn't have to pay again to park in the French Quarter. The room was spacious for 5 people, we had a small kitchen as well. The room was clean and the area around the hotel was safe. We didn't have any problems walking back and forth to it. Breakfast was decent with hot and cold food, pretty much the same everyday. My only complain was our room was close to a bar in front of the hotel and we could hear the cars and the music coming from it, it was noisy. Other than that, I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with good prices.”
Reviews.Author: lynclarke
Reviews.Content: A friend and I went to New Orleans because she had a government conference at this hotel. The room was comfortable: two queen beds, bathroom, and a separate area for the TV, sofa, microwave, little fridge, and sink. The hotel does use electronic door cards and the desk clerks do not announce one's room number. Check-in was done in a few minutes. The personnel were all friendly. (Check prices several times. I found a $67 senior rate in June about two weeks before our stay). The best part of the hotel was the breakfast. Great perk! Every morning there were waffles, scrambled eggs, hot oatmeal with lots of add-ons like pecans, brown sugar, raisins, coffee, juice, milks, fruit, bagels, english muffins, and lots of pastries. One attendant was there each morning taking care of the breakfast area. She kept everything clean and tidy and replenished food throughout the morning. She was a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe hotel in the middle of everything, but not really close to much.”
Reviews.Author: jesusers
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, clean and in a safe area. No problems venturing out at night. It's very close to some restaurants and museums, but a mile+ from Bourbon St. and the Garden District. This hotel is and excellent choice if you don't mind a walk or cabbing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...especially for convention center, but nothing spectacular.”
Reviews.Author: jpbloom55
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights due to a conference at the convention center. Great staff, good service, and a very classy looking place in a safe area. It's within easy walking distance of the convention center (I'd say three blocks) and WW2 museum (7 blocks?), but it's a hike to most tourist attractions. The pool and spa are nothing to write home about, but the workout room, although small, had some really nice equipment. The wi-fi was REALLY spotty in our room...that was disappointing, but it was free and did work most of the time. The rooms were awesome and the buffet breakfast was great. All in all, a good place to stay for a convention.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, decent location”
Reviews.Author: CherHaines
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Spring Hill Suites for 4 nights last month. The price was so right that we splurged on a room for me/hubby and another for my brother, our traveling companion. All-in-all a more than adequate accomodation, especially for $110/night. Spring Hill Suites is a limited service hotel, so includes free internet and breakfast, but no restaurant or bar. The location is good - 15 minutes walk to french quarter and 5 minutes to river walk. Rooms are fine, with sitting area/kitchen somewhat separated from sleeping area (partition, no wall). The room appeared to have been updated in the past few years. Breakfast was waffles, cereal, eggs, ham/sausage, pastry, fruit, beverages. Very adequate. Internet worked fine. TV was marginal - not a lot of stations and real slow to change channels, although was a flat screen with HD. Staff of the hotel was just ok. Several questions they couldn't answer (how much are cabs, how far to walk) and didn't seem too concerned about helping us find an answer. Limited Service hotel. If you have a car, be prepared to pay $20/night ++ to park here. Also there aren't many restaurants/bars nearby open on Sundays, be aware. But if you're willing to walk 15 minutes, lots of choices. All in all a good choice for touring New Orleans, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Service was adequate”
Reviews.Author: MeSoTan
Reviews.Content: We booked a double queen room with a sleeper sofa. The room was clean and the hotel was quiet. The free breakfast area was under staffed. So there was frequent delays for the hot food items. The hotel is close to the Convention Center. The internet connection was very slow. Do not take the restraurant referrals from the staff - they were all pricey. We had a great meal at the Ugly Dog Saloon for 1/3rd the price of Mulate's which nailed us for a 18% gratuity for a family of 5 and the worst service we have ever had - anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “OK, Not Top SpringHIll Locale”
Reviews.Author: A_and_B_from_PA
Reviews.Content: While I found no 'deal breakers' at this SpringHill location, it was not as strong as the other locations I have visited. The bed did not feel as comfortable, the accommodations felt more cramped, the breakfast felt a little below par for a Spring Hill, there was no bar and the business PCs/printer did not work well and no one on staff was qualified to fix it. There were tiny ants in the room and - worst of all - the room clearly has been used by a smoker and there were ashes to prove it! The location itself seemed decent enough within the Warehouse District feel and the SpringHill fit well as it felt to be almost a converted warehouse. The convention center, Riverwalk, World War II and Civil Museums are certainly within walking distance, but both the French Quarter and Garden Districts/Magazine Street shopping are a decent hike.

Reviews.Title: “Great property but the staff need some serious training”
Reviews.Author: lebdude
Reviews.Content: The property is very well located near the convention center and in walking distance to the casino, bourbon street and all Mardi Gras festivities. However the staff is in a serious need of training especially the front desk staff. They were the least helpful staff I've ever encountered i my life especially in a Marriott. you would expect such a treatment at a Motel6 or a Days Inn and not a Marriott property. I guess it was Mardi Gras and they assumed that everyone is there to enjoy while they were working and that's not fair to them. Breakfast staff and the Management were way better than the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Feen84
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers all basic amenities and a clean room. The room is a decent size, there were four of us staying in a standard room and we were not on top of each other. The free breakfast was standard, bagels, waffles, cereal etc. We did not get to use the pool and we actually never saw anyone use it but I can tell you that it is small. The location is great two blocks from the convention center and within walking distance to most of the night clubs. The staff was courteous and helpful, as long as you are not expecting anything fancy then you should be okay. On a side note we did not have a safe in our room which was not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: atlantic2580
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night while attending the Sugar Bowl and had an excellent stay. Hotel was located in the warehouse district and was within walking distance to the french quarter, riverwalk, and Harrah's. I asked for early check-in and when I arrived, the room was not ready. I was willing to wait, but they were able to find a similar room that was available. The room was big wth separate living room area. There was a microwave and fridge with sink. TV was LCD, but considering the size of the room, 2 TVs would've been better. The beds were nice and bathroom was good size. The room relatively quiet, although I could hear kids running down the halls. Breakfast was nice with several hot items like eggs, sausages, oatmeal, etc. Overall this was an excellent hotel. I wish I could've stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very decent place”
Reviews.Author: etothewolf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a national church gathering with around 350 other young adults (18-25 year olds). There were 4 people to a room and there was enough room for all our stuff. The fridge and microwave were great since we stayed there for about a week. The tv was in an awkward spot, between the "living room" area and the bed area so you couldn't watch the tv from both areas. Not that big of a deal for me. I slept on the pull out couch and it was really comfortable, more comfortable that some other hotels regular beds. The continental breakfast was great! There were so many things to choose from. There was hot and cold breakfast items, a few different types of yogurt, a couple different types of milk, bagels, fruit, coffee and tea (and to-go cups), juice, and many other things. The front desk was friendly and helpful with restaurant suggestions. They were accommodating even when our luggage arrived late. The only extra toiletry item they didn't have was contact solution. Oh well, our luggage arrived in the wee hours of the morning and they called up to our room to tell us it arrived. The only complaint I have is that many of the rooms for the young adults weren't ready until the evening we were supposed to check in. That was very frustrating since many of us had to get out of our rooms at 11 AM and then wait to get into our new rooms. I understand that there are many rooms to clean, but if you know this, maybe more staff is needed for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, a bit tired, but great front desk service”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoCalgirl
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its location near the convention center, where I was attending a conference. I requested a quiet, courtyard room since I am a light sleeper. The first room I was given was a courtyard room, but it had a loud hum (probably due to equipment in the wall). I immediately went downstairs, where the friendly staff gave me another room, which was much quieter, but the air conditioner had a loud rattle. Once again downstairs, the staff was most accommodating and I was given a third room which was perfect. I have never had to ask for a different room in any of my travels and I could understand that the staff would think I was difficult. But they treated me with nothing but helpful friendliness. They were wonderful throughout the weeklong stay. Beds were very nice and comfy; got a great nights' sleep (and I am picky about my beds!). Rooms were spotless, but they are tired and in need of remodeling. Breakfast was great, with a huge amount of choices: juices, yogurts, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, sweet rolls, english muffins, bagels, waffles with strawberry topping or syrup and whipped cream, eggs, sausage, dry cereal, oatmeal, apples. There was a pool, jacuzzi and fitness room, but you had to go through the lobby to access them -- I'm not walking through the lobby in my bathing suit, so I didn't get a chance to try them out. Some access improvement is definitely needed there. Location was great, and in walking distance of the French Quarter and a few blocks away were streetcars and buses. Cochon, a fabulous homestyle Cajun restaurant, is literally around the corner; Emeril's is a few blocks away. National WWII Museum also just a few blocks away. Neighborhood was fine (for New Orleans); I never felt unsafe walking around in the daytime. I could not get the wireless to sync to my laptop, but they had a kiosk in the lobby where you could check in to your flight and print out a boarding pass. The hotel is expensive for what you get (I paid $209/night when anywhere else it would be ~$100/night), but I guess all hotels in NOLA are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return”
Reviews.Author: JdiamondD
Reviews.Content: Check in staff member was rude to start, got up to my floor and realized it was the farthest room away, I went back downstairs and asked for a room closer to the elevator, the staff member stated "We are booked up" I doubt we have anything.. so could you look for me? so about halfway down the hall now.. open the door, room is shabby, one tv sitting on a nightstand that is positioned 1/2 way between the "den" and the bedroom, so you would have to turn it around to see from the bed or the couch.. awkward spot in the middle of the room. you open the door onto the footstool for the chair... dingy in the bathroom, walls need painting.. not what I expected!

Reviews.Title: “a good fit for our needs”
Reviews.Author: jaydee414
Reviews.Content: business associate and i just returned from a 4 nite stay at SH Suites...For 2 guys traveling primarily for susiness purposes, this is as good a deal as one can get. Two blocks from the Convention center, complimentary breakfast, decent room (size & cleanliness), 12 minute easy stroll to the quarter.... That being said, probably not a great option for families nor couples looking for a romantic getaway, but for us, it was more than adequate

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but below average hotel”
Reviews.Author: kayellpee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great place, but everything else about the hotel is average at best. The rooms are small and dirty, the staff is rude and unhelpful and the extra charges such as the parking are rediculous on top of the charge for the room. I am happy that I was able to get a discounted rate on Expedia because I would never have been happy paying for this experience at a full rate. The television in our room didn't work properly and I was told that nothing could be done about it. I also had a business associate who was meeting my husband and I for dinner and was told that for him to be able to park in the garage while we walked to dinner it would cost us $22, rediculous.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a relaxing stay off the beaten path or near the convention center.”
Reviews.Author: germy1969
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you are doing anything at the convention center. It is only two blocks away and felt very safe. There is an extensive free breakfast that even includes freshly made hot grits! (you gotta try them when in the south). Even though there is not restaurant, the hotel is surrounded by first class restaurants that are, literally, out the back door of hue hotel.. It is located in the trendy warehouse district and is directly across the street from The Howling Wolf which also stays open late and sells great food and drinks(homemade pountchatoula strawberry-infused vodka- hello!) to go. It is also in walking distance of the childrens museum which my daughter insisted on visiting twice . Having said that, there is nothing spectacular about the hotel itself. There was nothing to complain about either. Oh, the staff were EXTREMELY pleasant, especially the front desk and tall dreadlocked guy who worked in the breakfast area. I would definately recommend this place for anyone interested in finding comfortable accomadations in the convention center/ Wharehouse district

Reviews.Title: “A good value in downtown New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: mom-of-aj
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the few we could find with a fair price to book on the night of the NFL Kickoff Event in New Orleans. We needed a hotel where we could walk to the French Quarter easily because we knew parking would be a problem. The hotel was very easy to get to from the Interstate and is close to the Convention Center. The staff was very pleasant upon arrival and there was a small, secure garage to park in on site. The room was surprisingly comfortable with a large bed and bathroom and a small kitchen area which we enjoyed having. The furniture was nice-nothing special but the bed was very comfortable. We even had a little balcony/patio off our room. The walk to Jackson Square was a few blocks but you have to expect this in the middle of the French Quarter. The room was a very good value for the price. We even got a breakfast with waffles, eggs, sausage, pastries, etc.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: ckpianodude
Reviews.Content: We went to New Orleans for 4 days with the family. This hotel was exactly what I expected it to be. Spacious rooms, clean, quiet and friendly people at the reception. The French Quarter is easy to walk to from the hotel. There's a great Children's Museum just around the corner, and the St. Charles street car is just up a few blocks. Having a kitchenette in the room was perfect for us since we ate most of our meals in our room. Overall we had a great time and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Convention Center, but no free parking in NEW ORLEANS”
Reviews.Author: vadiva30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a convention and I loved it's proximity to the New Orleans Convention Center. My biggest gripe with this hotel was our parking issue. There is parking at the hotel but it costs $20 a day, $25 if they valet park for you. Don't even try to find parking on the street because that costs or you get a ticket. I know NO is trying to regain it's footing since Katrina but they could have given us discounts for parking at one of the parking lots. Back to the hotel itself. I was pleasantly surprised how roomy it was. We had two queen size beds and an area with a kitchenette with a hideaway bed couch and a chair with ottoman. Plus a desk with a nice leather chair with computer docking station. The towels were kind of sorry but over all it was clean and not a bad value. We paid $141 a night. They had a hot breakfast. My gripe about the breakfast was that the grits were lumpy but other than that it was a well rounded breakfast selection. There were a few restaurants in the immediate area. We walked five blocks to catch the trolly to see St. Charles Street (and the supposedly million dollar homes which wasn't much to look at) and we ended up on Bourbon street and had a great time. Overall this hotel was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Platinum Elite Member extremely disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: Tenn08
Reviews.Content: I have spent over 70 nights at a Marriott of some type during the past 8 months and have never been so disappointed as I was with this hotel!! This first night was a nightmare because the walls were so thin we could hear every word spoken next door (yes, they were loud) so we asked to be moved to another room. The carpet in the first room was bad, but the second room was horrible!! There were huge ink spots near the desk, a footprint on the carpet by the sofa, and bleach stains near the bathroom sink. The toilet had a ring around it so it had not been cleaned in quite a while. The chair and ottoman that was in the room was so soiled that I wouldn't even sit in it! Obviously by my status I am a huge fan of Marriott, but this was just short of being like an old Motel 6. I truly have stayed in Motel 6's that were better!! I definitely think Marriott needs to take a look at this hotel and either update (and clean) it up or consider closing it. If this had been the first Marriott that I had ever stayed in I would never stay in another one. Trust me, there are nice Marriott's.....this unfortunately is not one!!

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating”
Reviews.Author: dlcfields
Reviews.Content: I have never put in a bad request to any hotel this one is the first on so that can tell you how bad the service was. I go there on Friday morning about 10:30AM trying to do early check-in and they said check-in was at 3:00 but to check back a little later. I understood b/c it was so early and I know they were still doing checkout. About 1:30pm I called to confirm if they had avaiablity before going back. The gentlemen told me they had rooms available and it is ok to check-in. I made it back to the hotel close to 2:00PM and they told me again that check-in was at 3:00 and I couldnâ€™t check-in. I explained and showed them where I had called not even 30mins ago and spoke to a gentleman and he told me it was ok. It was 2 ladies at the front desk and 1 said â€œwell my managers told me 3:00â€� I asked to speak with one of them and she told me the both were gone and walked away. The other young lady sympathized with me and said the only reason they did not want early check-in was b/c the parking was not available on the proprety but as long as I put some money in the meter I was fine and prceeded to alow me to check-in and since I confirmed I should be allowed to check-in. I came down at 3:30PM to move my car on the property and they advised that still no parking on the property for $20 a day and I would have to valet for $30 a day and only allowed to use my car once a day and if I used my car a 2nd time it would be $10 for each trip. So I went ahead and valet parked and asked if I can check on the next day to park on the property for $20 a day. They said no problem. The next day, I checked at 11:00 about the parking and the lady at the front desk advised she was still checking out guest and had not had a chance to look at the list but to check back. I came back around 2. She told me that it is now to late to use the property parking as the latest I have to move my car out of valet was noon. I asked why didnâ€™t she tell me this and her exact words were, I didnâ€™t know you were coming back after noon and you didnâ€™t tell me you had your car in valet. WTH!!!! I have visited N.O. numerous times and have never encountered this kind of experience.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous staff, great breakfast and good location”
Reviews.Author: R0chestertraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Springhill suites in New Orleans and had a great experience - the front desk staff always greeted us coming and going and asked if there was any way in which they could help. The cleaning staff was always courteous. The rooms were neat - carpet clean and drapery in good condition. The breakfast was also great with several hot and cold choices daily and attendent that kept refills coming. Recommend for families and business stay as near Riverwalk and convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Very slow internet and small gym”
Reviews.Author: kailio
Reviews.Content: The internet connection is very slow. It has wired and wireless but its so slow its very frustrating. The rooms are clean. The gym is very small and limited in choices. The breakfast is good. The location to the convention center is good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Retro L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights. It is a short walk to the French Quarter. Our room was nice and clean. We had free wireless Internet. The pool was small and crowded, but served its purpose. The hot tub was nice. The free breakfast was not the best, but it was something. Embassy Suites definitely has them beat in that department. No concierge. Front desk staff was not too helpful or friendly. The parking situation was bad. We expected to park there, but we were told we had to park elsewhere. We had to find parking in a public lot. Glad we got our room at a discounted price!

Reviews.Title: “Valet Parking Ambush”
Reviews.Author: CareerRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't have enough parking to accomodate even half of it's guests. It has more than 100 rooms and less than 50 parking spaces. They advertise $20.00 per day parking, but be prepared to have to pay $30.00 to $40.00 per day for valet parking which is what I had to pay once I arrived to this hotel. I was told at check-in that their parking was full, and my only parking choice was valet parking or find another hotel. I hate valet parking because that is the most likely way to have your car either damaged or its contents ransacked while visiting New Orleans. Each time I needed my car I had to wait as long as 25 minutes for my car to be brought to me. Also, be aware that each time you drop your car off or have it brought to you the valet employees expect a tip. I would much rather stay at a hotel in New Orleans that offers sufficient parking for its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, shabby hotel needs a Marriott inspection and upgrade !!!”
Reviews.Author: orangebowl2010
Reviews.Content: First, I had a major problem at check-in. Front desk girl was inept. Room was shabbbby, with the blackout curtain hem torn down, stepped on, and dirty. Used to have 2 TVs; now only 1 and you have to crane your neck while in bed to see it. Only a handful of channels - not even the same as my basic cable line-up back home. Mattress pad was an acrylic blanket folded in half; it bunched up during the night and annoyed the heck out of me. Black, tarry stuff on the floor so I couldn't be barefoot. Had to call security due to a party next door, and they came to MY room (duh) ! Desk chair was broken; one they replaced it with had a hunk taken out of the arm (annoying). Internet is wired, so don't stray too far from the desk. Best part is the Red-Eye Grill across the street - best burgers in NOLA. Music lovers will enjoy the Republic, next to the Red-Eye. Location is the best part of this hotel - within walking distance to everything. No cab rides for me! When I went up to Audubon Park, grabbed the streetcar for $1.25. I have stayed at this hotel many times, but it is getting worse each time. Marriott - help!!

Reviews.Title: “totally perfect trip”
Reviews.Author: michaelvirginiabeach
Reviews.Content: spend 4 wonderful days in new orleans and just loved this hotel...room was perfect with free wifi which was quick...laundry room worked great...parking was even cheap for a big city ($20). would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but do not get a room facing onto St.Peters Street”
Reviews.Author: TexasAl_10
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff welcome you to a clean hotel. Rooms are a good size. The oldest of my 3 children slept on the sofa bed and it was good. However there is a nightclub on St.Peters Street on which some of the rooms face including ours. This place has a sound system which could cause an earthquake and is open until 4 am, only the deaf or the dead could sleep through it. Ask for a room facing the inner courtyard on the 2nd floor and enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
